stories.storyText:
[Code Name] Platinum
[Gender] Female
[Combat Experience] 6 years
[Place of Birth] Kazimierz
[Date of Birth] February 13
[Race] Kuranta
[Height] 160cm
[Infection Status] 
Medical tests have confirmed that no infection is present.

[Physical Strength] Standard 
[Mobility] Excellent 
[Physical Resilience] Normal 
[Tactical Acumen] Standard 
[Combat Skill] Excellent 
[Originium Arts Assimilation] Standard

Platinum was previously an assassin for the Kazimierz Armorless Union. The rest of her background is unknown. She has demonstrated considerable talent and special tactical accomplishments in high-mobility operations, clearance, and urban warfare.
Under the leadership of Dr. Kal'tsit, she is a Sniper Operator for Rhodes Island.

Imaging tests reveal clear, normal outlines of internal organs, and no abnormal shadows have been detected. Originium granules have not been detected in the circulatory system and there is no sign of infection. At this time, this Operator is believed to be non-infected.

[Cell-Originium Fusion Rate] 0% 
Operator shows no signs of infection at this time.

[Blood Crystal Density] 0.11u/L 
This Operator has rarely come into contact with Originium. 

Physical indicators have all tested at normal levels. After the conclusion of the examination process, I have taken over this Operator's relevant investigation and data files.
- Kal'tsit

The only information that has been confirmed about Platinum is her hometown in Kazimierz. All other information that Platinum shares must be taken with a grain of salt, including medical data like chest size and weight. Platinum prefers to falsify this data (often through threats and blackmail) as she believes 
'A girl should be allowed to have her secrets!'
Therefore, most of the information in Platinum's file has no value. 
Of course, core records and non-public materials are still subject to close scrutiny.

The Knight-Assassins are a secret military force cultivated by the various forces of Kazimierz during political struggles with rogue knights. 
The story goes that in order to counter the rogue knights who were well versed in combat, the Knight Assassins utilized special assassination and guerrilla combat techniques. Consequently, they launched a relentless campaign of destruction against the rogue knights that refused to cooperate with the reigning government. 
Although it is impossible to verify the authenticity of these rumors, Platinum does exhibit some of the skills that could have been used to fight the Kazimierz knights. Both in aspects that can't be measured as well as her measurable if incredible bow skills, under special circumstances, Platinum poses a huge threat to armored targets. 
In light of these findings, investigations into Platinum must continue.

In the end, Platinum chose to join the team directly led by Dr. Kal'tsit in order to develop her own strengths and to prove that her relationship with Rhodes Island was genuine. This is an acceptable result for Rhodes Island. 
Aside from teasing other Operators, shirking her daily chores, and other minor rule violations, Platinum has proven that she has the essence of an outstanding Operator. 
Even so, Platinum needs to make sure she applies for 'read permission' from management and not steal glances during the data compilation process.
I hope Dr. Kal'tsit will consider putting an end to some of her more outrageous behaviors. Thank you.

[Classified Log] 
Even though Platinum currently follows my instructions and orders, she seems to care little for Rhodes Island itself. Even from the perspective of the employment relationship, Rhodes Island's pay may not be able to satisfy her. As such, it is critical we seriously consider whether Platinum will remain loyal. 
Of course, according to my personal observations, the relationship between Platinum and Rhodes Island is mostly derived from her trust in the Doctor. 
In other words, as long as Platinum's relationship with the Doctor is strong enough, she will continue to hold considerable value for Rhodes Island. 
There are multiple ways we can go about removing the variable factors in this situation. Strengthening our relationship to dispel excessive notions of independence ought to be feasible. 
- Kal'tsit

Currently, all of the intelligence Rhodes Island has regarding the Kazimierz Armorless Union comes from Platinum herself and should not be regarded as the full truth. 
At the same time, when conducting secret missions into the large cities of Kazimierz, attention must be paid to the next steps the Armorless Union takes. Rhodes Island should be vigilant of other groups of unknown alignment operating in the shadows.

skins.description:
An outfit commonly worn by Operators.
While not as practical as a uniform, it's what they find most comfortable.

An outfit that has been improved after the Operator's Promotion.
Custom-made to suit each Operator's experiences and needs, these outfits are designed to provide them maximum flexibility on any battlefield. Furthermore, this is all done without compromising the comfort that they've come to expect.
<color name=#ffffff>MARTHE [Coral Coast] Shimmering Dew Series SD05. Tight-fitting, breathable, lightweight, and designed for the summer.</color>

modules.desc:
Operator Platinum has demonstrated a remarkable aptitude for maintaining distance whilst conducting suppressive fire against the enemy.
The Field Operations Department has thus passed the following resolution:
This operator shall be appointed a Sniper Operator during field operations to exercise Marksman responsibilities.
In witness whereof,
This badge is hereby conferred upon the above named.

Off went Platinum to Sami for her vacation.
She'd invited the Doctor too, but just as she didn't hope for a raise to her pitifully low Rhodes Island salary anytime soon, she didn't truly expect the Doctor, buried somewhere under that mountain of paperwork, to tag along with her.
Still, she got herself two months of vacation. So that was great.
After setting foot on Sami soil, a Columbian graciously led her to her villa. Snow was falling on the plains, and across it quietly traveled a procession of people, the one at the head bearing flowers plucked from who-knows-where. They all silently followed him, walking towards the lakeside.
Amongst them, a child slipped and fell to the ground, and Platinum helped them back up, petals falling into her palms as she did. Her mind flicked back to the past, when she was still an independent knight. To fans flocking to give her flowers—beautiful ones, fragrant ones, ones that seemed like they'd last forever. The flower-bearing procession was now some distance away when she had the sudden urge to see who they were giving them to.
Looming by the lakeside was a deep white altar, all around which they laid the flowers.
'They're honoring the memory of a deceased hero. The one leading 'em's a descendant. It's a custom of their tribe,' explained Platinum's Columbian hire.
They cast the flowers into the lake and began to dance, singing a nameless song whose melody was deep and somber, and they beat a flame alight. Some wept, while others spoke silently mouthed words, pure and reverent light flickering in their eyes.
Platinum and the Columbian watched from afar as they shared food around the bonfire, before they drew she herself in. Language failed to connect them, but mood did not, and there she tried a cup of local wine, and was given a red flower by an elderly woman.
'Too noisy...' she thought. Soon after, the child who'd fallen over pulled her by the hand and merrily spun around, running as he did for the bonfire before bringing more food back.
She accepted his kindness, and watched the people before her.
The tribe raised the hero. The hero fought Ursus all his life, then died on the border. Countless descendants had come in his memory to tell her, a simple stranger, his story. The story of an escaped assassin, of what was hidden inside a meat pie cut open and swallowed by knife and fork, of a soft napkin wiping non-existent bloodstains and crumbs.
The lakeside was a distance from the plains, and the Columbian still stood wrapped in a blanket far away, illuminated by the villas' twinkling lights, waiting for Platinum to give the word to lead the way. Platinum stood by the bonfire, simply watching the people, never saying a word.

voice_lines.voiceText: *Yaaawn*... Doctor, could I take a quick break?
Don't worry about my bow. I keep it well maintained. It's much tougher than you, so stop asking about it already.
There are so many interesting people at Rhodes Island. Would be nice if I could make a friend or two to travel with.
Nowadays, the Knights of Kazimierz are little more than a bunch of musclehead jocks, or clowns obsessed with billboards and firework shows. Man, it's so lame.
I was planning to return home after finishing this job, but now I've changed my mind. Why, you ask? You should know better than to ask a girl a question like that.

Want to know the origin of my codename? You see, there are different ranks for the Knight Assassins in Kazimierz. There's three Darksteel and two Lazurite assassins above me, but I and I alone bear the rank of Platinum, from now till the day I die. So I figured it'd make a good codename.
Ah, it's Miss Nearl! No, no, I wasn't going to lay a hand on her. I'm just worried she's going to charge at me with her hammer.
Kazimierz is... a boring place. *Sigh*, I'm almost mad at how much more amusing life here at Rhodes Island is.

Have you thought about how you're going to maintain your relations with everyone here at Rhodes Island? You know, all suits of armor have small gaps which leave you vulnerable, and that's where the enemies always try to jam their blades. One hit to your weak point can bring down everything you've painstakingly built.
I'm so bored. Hoping something amusing happens.
Assassin of the Armorless Union of Kazimierz here as per our agreement. What am I called? Hmm... Call me Platinum, then. Nice to meet you.
Good. My bow feels even lighter. Thank you.
Promotion? Isn't the rank of Platinum already intimidating enough? Oh, you are an interesting one.
Hah. Do you have the guts to gaze upon the true face of the one called Platinum, my dear Doctor?
Platinum, reporting for duty.
Really? I'm commanding? It's not my strongest suit, but all right.
Will this battle be an interesting one?
You may as well attack at the same time. You're all too weak anyway.
Your orders?
Who's my target?
I'll make them disappear.
Moving to intercept.
First, break their legs.
Second, break their armor.
And third, pierce their flesh.
Now, it's checkmate!
Nice. I had quite an enjoyable time.
Checkmate. I'm sorry, but victory is mine.
What a pity that we left some alive.
Don't give up... He who laughs last laughs best.
The atmosphere here is surprisingly good.
Huh?!
Want to go on a walk? If you're busy, there's always next time.
Arknights.

Huh? Wasn't expecting to run into you here. Me? I'm just feeling the breeze. It's too noisy down there, and too many people. I want to be alone. Hm. Still sticking yourself here like a little dope after you've learned my answer? Could it be... You want to stay with me a bit longer? Ugh—whatever, this place is boring. How about we just ditch in secret?
You look well, Doctor.

A kind little reminder from me. Those tickets I gave you WILL expire. Don't make me tie you up and drag you there, okay? ...Day after tomorrow? Alright, it's a deal then. No backsies. What, why am I smiling? Is this your first time going to an amusement park with someone? That's cute. Interpret it however you like, little dummy.

Missions: boring, enemies: boring, but it's still way better than Kazimierz no matter how you slice it. Just getting further and further away from there feels great. The wind from Kazimierz will never again blow my arrows off its mark, and I never want to breathe its air ever again.
